info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding resulting from thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall. * WHERE...Much of Halifax county in south central Virginia. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain continuing within the advisory area due to thunderstorms. From 1.5 to 2.0 inches of rain has fallen within parts of the advisory area during the past couple of hours. An additional 1 to 1.5 inches of rain will be possible during the next hour or so. This heavy rainfall will result in flooding of low- lying and normally flood prone areas and other minor flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Banister River, Aarons Creek, Ballous Creek and Bales Spring Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Boston... Halifax... Virgilina... Turbeville... Ingram... Milton... Scottsburg... - For additional information on creeks, streams, rivers, and lakes please go to our web page located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Precuationary Statements: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
